sections.Body:
This framework structures the finance department's evolution, using the time elapsed as a proxy for the complexity driven by funding stages and operational scale.

| Timeframe | Strategic Focus & Key Actions | Optimal Hires & Archetypes |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Year One** | **Foundational Establishment.** Starting the finance function from first principles. Focus on robust **accounting and banking infrastructure**. | **Options:** Fractional Accounting Outsourcing (until $\sim$25 employees), Senior Executive Oversight (temporary), Internal Controller, or VP/Head of Finance (Generalist). |
| **Year Two** | **Strategic Transition.** Shift from pure accounting to **strategic, value-added services and repeatable processes**. Accounting foundation must be stable. | **Required:** Full-Time FP\&A Analyst/Manager. **Supporting:** Strong Generalist (e.g., FinOps), Senior Accountant (HRIS/Payroll). **Strategic:** Fractional CFO (between Seed and Series A). |
| **Year Three** | **Process Refinement & Specialization.** Narrowing scope for efficiency. Team complexity reaches the inflection point for managerial needs. | **Required:** Specialist Hires (e.g., Payroll Specialist at 150–200 employees). **Strategic:** Full-Time CFO (typically post-Series D) with deep startup experience. |
| **Year Four+** | **Internalization and Optimization.** Bringing outsourced functions in-house. Focus remains on customer value proposition. | **Required:** Internal Tax Function (at $\sim$25 employees or three-year mark). |
sections.A Cautionary Retrospective on Preceding:
In my tenure at **Paribus**, my preceding company, the **lack of disciplined expense management** became a substantial liability during the acquisition process. Our reliance on basic credit card records was insufficient; the audit requirements necessitated a receipt for any expenditure exceeding **\$75** to qualify for taxable deduction, directly impacting the buyer's benefit calculation. The subsequent weeks I spent retroactively tracking years of expenses were arduous and inefficient, directly providing the impetus to create a software solution (**Acme software**) designed to prevent this exact organizational failure.
